channel.title: 位相学補完計画
channel.description: Recent content on 位相学補完計画

item.description: Chapter 9: Computing Integrals # 9.1.1 Introduction # In practice, how do we compute integral $\int_A f(x)dx$? In $\mathbb{R}^1$ (one-dimensional space): $$\int_a^b f(x)dx = F(x)|_a^b = F(b) - F(a)$$ FTC (Fundamental Theorem of Calculus) In $\mathbb{R}^n$ (n-dimensional space): Reduce to $\mathbb{R}^1$ case by Fubini’s Theorem Change of Variables (Substitution) first 9.1.2 Fubini’s Theorem # 1. Statement of Main Result # Theorem 1: Let $A = {(x,y): a \leq x \leq b, c \leq y \leq d}$ be a rectangle in $\mathbb{R}^2$ and $f: A \to \mathbb{R}$ be integrable.
